title: INTRACEL - ME CLINIC SEOUL
full_content:
What is INTRACEL MICRONEEDLING?

\- The INTRAcel™ technology combines micro-needling to penetrate the skin and uses radio frequency to deliver heat energy deep into the skin tissue. 

\- The layers of the skin respond to the thousands of tiny microscopic energy points by generating new collagen growth which encourages the skin to tighten and heal naturally. The effect is similar to peeling, but with minimal impact. This results in thicker, firmer skin rejuvenation. 

\- For acne and acne scarring, INTRAcel™ uses radio frequency energy to reduce the production of sebum and bacteria. The RF energy helps promote the production of elastin and collagen which minimize the appearance of acne scarring. 

What can INTRAcel™ be used for??

\- The results of INTRAcel™ Microneedling treatments help the skin look smoother and younger, reducing the signs of aging by tightening the skin and improving tone and texture.  
INTRAcel™ has also proven to be effective in diminishing signs of acne and acne scarring, as well as reducing large unsightly pores and unwanted stretch marks. INTRAcel™ also has dramatic effects on acne and acne scarring. 

How soon will I notice results?

\- After just one treatment, your skin is stimulated to produce more collagen so will start to feel smoother and tighter with visible results showing after two or more INTRAcel™ sessions. Treatments are specific to you, with one to three treatments normally being required. 

How long does INTRAcel™ last?

\- Results can vary, depending on the original quality of your skin and degree of damage. Normally INTRAcel™ treatments continue to improve the skin for up to six months for plumper, glowing skin and smaller pores.

title: Ultherapy Lifting - ME CLINIC SEOUL
full_content:
What is Ultherapy?

Ultherapy is a safe, non-surgical ultrasound treatment that counteracts the effects of time and gravity on your skin. Ultherapy uses the body's own regenerative response to gently and gradually lift skin on the eyebrow, under the chin and on the neck, and smooth lines and wrinkles on the décolletage. ​​ 

Can Ultherapy replace a face lift?

Ultherapy treats the deep foundational layer addressed in cosmetic surgery, but won't duplicate the results of a facelift. Ultherapy is a great alternative, however, especially for those not ready for surgery or for patients looking to extend the effects of cosmetic surgery. 

When will I see results? How long do they last?

After your Ultherapy® Treatment, you may see some initial effect, but the ultimate results will take place over 2-3 months, as your body naturally regenerates collagen. Since the procedure stimulates your own collagen production, how long the results last really depends on you. The treatment produces new collagen on the inside, but your natural aging process will dictate how long that translates into visible results on the outside. 

Is Ultherapy safe?

The FDA-cleared Ultherapy® procedure has been used safely in over half a million treatments worldwide. Ultrasound energy has been used safely in the medical field for more than 50 years. In addition, every Ultherapy practitioner receives extensive procedural training, 

Are there any side effects?

The skin might appear flushed at first, but the redness should disappear within a few hours. Some patients experience slight swelling, tingling or tenderness to the touch, but these are temporary in nature. Other, less common post-procedural effects may include temporary bruising or numbness on small areas of skin. As with any medical procedure, there is the possibility for other rare effects, which your practitioner will review with you.

\- Less pain by half compared to previous versions

title: Fat reduction shots (Cut line injection) - ME CLINIC SEOUL
full_content:
\- Mesotherapy, which is the injection of substances locally into mesodermally derived subcutaneous tissue, developed from empirical observations of a French physician in the 1950s. Although popular in Europe for many medical purposes, it is used for local cosmetic fat reduction in the United States.

\- Aminophylline is a mixture of theophylline and ethylenediamine. It is a common asthma medication and has a mode of action and efficacy similar to that of caffeine. In mesotherapy, it is used to promote the breakdown of fat and induce vasodilation. Aminophylline effectively inhibits phosphodiesterase, thereby increasing cAMP concentration, which allows for more efficient breakdown of fat in the cell.

\- Aminophylline has a narrow therapeutic index. Adverse reactions can be encountered at dosages of around 250mg in most individuals. Side effects include nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Cardiac arrhythmias and seizures are possible at serum levels exceeding 20mg/ml. As with yohimbine, I believe exclusion of aminophylline from the injection solution will not largely affect the outcome of the mesotherapy treatment, but allows for a much safer approach to treatment.

\- Mesotherapy involves microinjections (2-12mm depth) of solution (0.1-0.3mL) into the subcutaneous tissue of the area(s) to be treated. Typically, treatments are performed weekly, bi-weekly or monthly depending on the area to be treated. 

FAQ

Q) How the payment plan works? A) 5 sessions package - 2 division payments on 1 st and 3rd session 10 sessions package - 3 division payments on 1st, 3rd and 5th session 

Q) How many sessions do I need to have? A) It depends on patient body status but mostly effect will show after 5~8 sessions 

Q) How effective are injections? A) This injection is mainly targeted to dermal fat layer so has less effective result on losing weight but has desirable result on reducing fats on superficial layers but still result is not dramatic as surgical liposuction.

title: Thermage - ME CLINIC SEOUL
full_content:
BE AN ORIGINAL.  
GET BACK TO THE REAL YOU. 

What is Thermage?

The Thermage® system is a non-invasive radiofrequency (RF) therapy that can help smooth, tighten and contour skin for an overall younger-looking appearance.

How many treatments will I need? Does it hurt?

  * Unlike many cosmetic procedures requiring multiple sessions, Thermage FLX delivers results after a single treatment. Best of all, results continue to improve over time. 
  * The Thermage® FLX system incorporates vibration on the face and body treatments, which has been shown to help aid in patient comfort. You’ll feel a brief heating sensation when the treatment device’s tip touches your skin, followed by a cooling sensation to help protect your skin and minimize any discomfort. 



How long will the results last?

For most patients, measurable results appear gradually in the two to six months following a single treatment session and can last for 1-2 years depending on your skin condition and aging process. 

* Recommended by physicians as part of an annual skin rejuvenation maintenance program. 

Are there common side effects?

Some patients have temporary redness or minor swelling after treatment, but this usually goes away within 24 hours. 

How long before I can get back to the work?

Most patients return to their regular activities immediately following treatment. No special care is required afterward, aside from basic skin maintenance and broad-spectrum sunscreens as part of a regular skincare regimen. 

Real benefits of Thermage

  * Multiple treatment areas
  * Lasting Result
  * Patient comfort
  * Little to no downtime
  * No surgery and No injections

title: Silhouette soft lifting - ME CLINIC SEOUL
full_content:
See how Silhouette Soft® works

\- Silhouette Soft® uses a double action effect to restore smoother and more toned skin, but also a more shapely face.

\- To meet this requirement, Silhouette Soft® combines two effects:   
An immediate repositioning of the tissue and a gradual regeneration of collagen. 

\- The repositioning effect is immediate and discreet. It is the result of tissue compression and skin elevation at the time of implanting the suture.

\- After inserting the suture, the doctor applies slight pressure on the treated area. In this way, the doctor reshapes the contours of your face and makes it visibly smoother.

![Silhouette soft lifting image 3](/data/editor/1903/6f641a3c30ec7c903f75e9fcb826ca8d_1551450536_3912.png)

\- The regenerating effect is gradual: Poly L-lactic acid (PLLA), the principal component of Silhouette Soft® is a well-known polymer that has been used for many years in a number of biomedical and pharmaceutical applications: suture thread, orthopedic pins, rods, screws and nails for bone fractures. It is because this polymer shows excellent biocompatability and is biodegradable that such applications have been developed.

\- The small cones on the Silhouette Soft® Suture provide traction and fixation points, a natural foreign body reaction then reinforces this, by the build-up of new collagen formation.

\- This action is what helps restore shapeliness to the face and neck.

![Silhouette soft lifting image 4](/data/editor/1903/6f641a3c30ec7c903f75e9fcb826ca8d_1551450536_8658.png)

title: Patient's Rights and Responsibilities
full_content:
Patient Rights  
  
Right to Receive Treatment  
Patients have the right to receive healthcare services to protect and promote their health without discrimination based on gender, age, religion, status, nationality, language, race, or physical, mental, or economic circumstances. Medical professionals must not refuse treatment without a valid reason.  
  
Right to Information and Self-Determination  
Patients have the right to receive sufficient explanations from medical professionals about their areas of expertise, the patient’s medical condition, treatment goals, plans, methods, expected outcomes, potential side effects, discharge plans, medical costs, participation in medical research, and organ donation or transplantation. Patients can ask detailed questions and make informed decisions about their care. Within ethical boundaries, patients may discontinue or refuse specific treatments or planned care and request explanations of alternative options.

  
Right to Privacy Protection  
Patients’ physical and health-related privacy, as well as their personal information, must be protected. Medical professionals and institutions cannot disclose or publish personal information without the patient’s consent, except in cases defined by law, such as criminal investigations.

Right to Request Counseling and Mediation  
If a dispute arises related to medical services, patients have the right to seek counseling and mediation through internal or external organizations

(e.g., Korea Consumer Agency, Korea Medical Dispute Mediation and Arbitration Agency).

  
Right to Respect for Values and Beliefs  
Patients must not face discrimination or have their rights infringed upon due to cultural, religious, or personal beliefs.

  
Right to Physical Protection and Stability  
Patients have the right to be protected from potential risks in the hospital environment and to achieve physical and emotional stability.

Patient Responsibilities

  
Obligation to Trust and Respect Medical Profe

title: Meet the Editor | #safetyinbeauty
full_content:
![](https://safetyinbeauty.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/antonia-mariconda--237x300.jpg)Antonia Mariconda founded The Safety in Beauty Campaign in 2013, and The Safety in Beauty Diamond Awards in 2014, her passion and focus has been on raising the awareness of safety in the cosmetic surgery, beauty, and aesthetics industry for the consumer, her contributions to paving a safer way for the consumer have been documented in hundreds of press and media articles and have culminated in a meeting with the Prime Minister Theresa May in 2017.

Antonia frequently consults and works with local and government authorities to advise and guide on safer pathways and recommendations.

Antonia’s daily work at The Safety in Beauty Campaign includes responding to dozens of public queries, questions and concerns into the practice of aesthetics, beauty and cosmetic surgery and she has passionately dedicated her work as a consumer ambassador to ensuring the public have an independent entity to support and voice their collective concerns via Safety in Beauty.

Antonia Mariconda has tirelessly worked within the Aesthetics and Beauty industry for over twenty years, writing, consulting, producing, educating, creating, and campaigning for a safer beauty and aesthetics industry, she is a former winner of Best Beauty Blogger 2013 at The _MyFacemyBody_ Awards, and has been nominated for several awards during her career.

As the Editor of Safety in Beauty, she is committed to keeping you up to date with news, developments and topics in the beauty and aesthetics industry and reviewing treatments, products and services that have a safety ethos at the core.

> ##### _‘From cosmetic surgery to clean beauty, my heart and soul at The Safety in Beauty Campaign is dedicated to inspiring beauty safely” – Antonia Mariconda_

full_content:
# Douglas Farris, M.D.  
Dermatologist in Southlake, Texas

Douglas Farris, M.D. is an experienced dermatologist who has been in private practice for over 25 years, and has a broad educational background. Dr. Farris grew up in the metroplex, graduating from Arlington High School. After receiving a bachelor’s degree in science with a major in biology from Baylor University, he worked in a research lab at the Texas Medical Center in Houston studying the nutritional content of maternal breast milk. He then went to Purdue University and received a Master of Science degree in nutrition, with a thesis studying the effects of different sources of dietary fiber on cholesterol metabolism. After finishing his studies at Purdue, Dr. Farris went to medical school at the UT Health Science Center in San Antonio. After graduating from medical school, Dr. Farris completed two consecutive three-year residency programs, becoming board certified in both. The first residency was in internal medicine at the University of Vermont, where he received an award for outstanding teaching resident. The second was in dermatology at New York Medical College, where he was able to see a very diverse patient population in New York City, learning how to diagnose skin diseases in skin of all colors, and seeing a very wide range of skin conditions both common and rare.

title: Emerald Laser Monroe, LA
full_content:
## How Does Emerald Laser™ Work?

Emerald Laser™ works by emitting low-level green laser energy that targets and emulsifies fat cells beneath the skin. This advanced technology creates temporary pores in the fat cells, allowing the stored fat to be released and naturally processed by the body’s lymphatic system. This results in a slimmer, more contoured appearance without the need for surgery or downtime.

## What is the Emerald Laser™ Treatment Like?

During the Emerald Laser™ treatment, the laser is applied externally to the target area. The procedure is completely unattended, meaning it does not require constant supervision by a technician, enhancing convenience and comfort for patients. The low-level laser energy penetrates the skin and targets the fat cells without affecting the surrounding tissues. This makes the treatment safe and pain-free. The laser energy creates temporary pores in the fat cell membranes, causing the fat inside to be released. This process is called emulsification. Once released, the emulsified fat is then naturally processed and eliminated by the body’s lymphatic system.

## What Results Can I Expect from Emerald Laser™?

Most patients require a series of treatments with Emerald Laser™ to achieve optimal results. Each session is quick, typically lasting about 30 minutes, and there is no downtime, allowing you to resume your normal activities immediately after the treatment. Over the following weeks, the body continues to eliminate the fat, resulting in a noticeable reduction in fat deposits and a slimmer, more contoured appearance. On average, patients experience a circumference loss of about six inches.

Actinic keratosis is a condition that typically develops before skin cancer emerges. It is caused by exposure to ultraviolet light, such as what you experience from sunlight. Without treatment, actinic keratosis becomes skin cancer.

Dr. Hopkins uses a 30-gauge, blunt-tipped microcannula to deposit dermal fillers under the skin, especially for the delicate eyelid trough and lip. Hand rejuvenation with Radiesse® is administered with a 27-gauge microcannula. The technique is preferred over needles in some cases, such as for treating the lower eyelids and lips. The skin is cleansed and numbed. A needle is used to make a tiny hole in the skin. Next, the microcannula is slipped under the skin and gently pulled along the tissue to deposit the filler. The technique is safe and causes less tissue trauma compared to needle administration.

title: Photodynamic Therapy (PDT) Monroe, LA
full_content:
## How Do I Know If I Need Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)?

Photodynamic therapy is recommended for some types of cancer. The technique is widely used and Dr. Hopkins has been using this in both practices for over 20 years to treat pre-cancers with excellent results and minimum to no complications.

## What Should I Expect from Photodynamic Therapy (PDT)?

After the photosensitizing medications are administered topically, the pre-cancer cells absorb the medications. A special high-intensity light is applied to the treatment area to kill the cells. The procedure may also damage blood vessels that feed the pre-cancer cells. Your immune system takes over and continues to kill the pre-cancer. Dr. Hopkins monitors your progress to ensure that the pre-cancer does not return and that you do not develop new lesions in the surrounding tissues.

## Be Healthy, Be Beautiful. Contact Hopkins Dermatology Today.

_Photodynamic therapy, or PDT, is a widely-used technique for treating pre-cancer, but it has many benefits compared to surgery and other alternatives. As a board-certified dermatologist, Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D. offers Photodynamic Therapy (PDT) for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana. [Contact](https://www.hopkinsdermatology.com/contact-us/) Hopkins Dermatology to schedule an appointment._

title: Jeuveau Monroe, LA | Southlake, TX Jeuveau
full_content:
## What is Jeuveau®?

Jeuveau® is an injectable neurotoxin treatment that is specifically designed for cosmetic use. As a neurotoxin, the Jeuveau® formula works by relaxing the facial muscles that are responsible for creating and exaggerating facial wrinkles. By temporarily relaxing these muscles, the appearance of wrinkles fades, leaving patients with a more youthful appearance. Specifically, Jeuveau® is designed to treat glabellar lines, or frown lines, which are the wrinkles that develop between the eyes.

## How Much Does Jeuveau® Cost in Monroe, LA and Southlake, TX?

The cost of Jeuveau® treatments will vary based on the extent of treatment necessary to produce the desired results. During your consultation, we will develop your personalized treatment plan and provide you with detailed pricing information for your Jeuveau® treatment.

## What are the Benefits of Jeuveau®?

Jeuveau® provides many benefits as a neurotoxin injectable treatment, including:

  * Reduction of frown lines
  * Quick 30-minute treatment
  * Little to no downtime



## What is the Jeuveau® Treatment Like?

The Jeuveau® treatment is performed in-office by one of our providers. Prior to treatment, the skin may be numbed if desired to minimize any discomfort from the injection process. Then, the Jeuveau® formula will be injected into the area between the eyes, targeting the muscles responsible for glabellar lines. After the injections are performed, the treatment is complete. This process takes less than 30 minutes, making Jeuveau® a convenient treatment that can be performed on your lunch break.

## What is Recovery Like After Jeuveau®?

After Jeuveau®, you can expect some minor redness, swelling and sensitivity in the treatment area. However, these side effects typically resolve within a few days, and will not affect your usual activities. In fact, you can resume your normal activities immediately after your Jeuveau® treatment.

full_content:
## How Much Does Cryosurgery Cost in Monroe, LA and Southlake, TX?

Cryosurgery is tailored to the patient, so the cost does vary. We can provide the most accurate pricing at the time of your appointment with Dr. Hopkins.

## What Are the Benefits of Cryosurgery?

Cryosurgery is often the last option for safely and effectively removing skin cancer and abnormal growths. Compared to other methods, cryosurgery is less invasive, and patients heal from the procedure more quickly.

## How Do I Know If I Need Cryosurgery?

If you have a skin growth or cancer, Dr. Hopkins will begin treatment with the most conservative treatment possible. When other options fail to produce the desired result, cryosurgery is used to treat the area.

## What Should I Expect from Cryosurgery?

Due to the cell-damaging properties of liquid nitrogen, Dr. Hopkins takes great care to ensure that only the targeted tissue is affected by the nitrogen. She may use a spray or swab to apply the nitrogen to the growth. The growth may fall away from the healthy skin immediately or may take some time to dislodge from the skin. You will need to keep the skin dry and clean until the wound is completely healed.

title: Hormone Replacement Therapy Monroe, LA
full_content:
## How Much Does Hormone Replacement Therapy Cost in Monroe, LA and Southlake, TX?

Hormonal imbalances are highly unique situations that require equally unique treatments. As such, the cost of hormone replacement therapy will vary by patient, and cannot be specified until evaluating a patient’s needs. During your consultation, we will develop your personalized HRT treatment and provide you with detailed pricing information. **Before this visit, we ask that patients fill out the questionnaire below so that Dr. Hopkins can best understand and evaluate your needs.**

[**Male Questionnaire**](https://www.hopkinsdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/MaleHRTQuestionairre-1portrait.pdf)

[**Female Questionnaire**](https://www.hopkinsdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/FemaleHRTQuestionnaire-1portrait.pdf)

## What are the Signs of a Hormonal Imbalance in Women?

For women, hormonal changes typically begin gradually during perimenopause. These changes will begin to accelerate with a significant dropoff during menopause. The most common symptoms during this time include:

  * Hot flashes
  * Changes in mood
  * Irregular periods
  * Poor memory and cognitive function
  * Vaginal dryness and loss of libido
  * Sleeping difficulties or insomnia



With HRT for women, which typically includes either progesterone and estrogen, but may also include testosterone, these symptoms can be managed and improved. Additionally, hormone replacement therapy can help reduce the risk of certain diseases and provide other health benefits.

title: Scar Revision Monroe, LA
full_content:
_Scars serve an important purpose — to quickly close a wound and prevent infection. Unfortunately, this part of the body’s healing process leaves a mark that stands out from the surrounding skin. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., _board-certified _ dermatologist, offers scar revision for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana._

## What is Scar Revision?

The reason that scars are easily detected is that collagen fibers were quickly produced to close a wound. Collagen fibers are an important part of your skin, and when collagen production operates at a normal rate, the fibers develop in a structured pattern. In the case of a wound, though, the fibers develop quickly and without any clear pattern. Therefore, your scar has a different color and texture than the surrounding skin. Scar revision helps to blend the scar in with the natural color.

title: Melanoma Monroe, LA | Southlake, TX Melanoma
full_content:
## What Should I Expect from Melanoma Treatment?

Because melanoma spreads quickly to other areas of the body, treatment involves removing the cancerous tissues. This is typically accomplished by excising the cancer with a clean margin. The margin includes a specific amount of healthy tissue. This ensures that all cancer cells are removed, including those that may not be detectable by visual inspection. The tissue is sent to a lab for evaluation and to verify that the margin is clean. If the melanoma has spread, Dr. Hopkins may refer you to an oncologist for additional treatment.

## Be Healthy, Be Beautiful. Contact Hopkins Dermatology Today.

_Melanoma is the most life-threatening type of skin cancer, but there is help for the condition. Dr. Janine Hopkins, M.D., F.A.A.D., board-certified dermatologist, offers melanoma treatments for men and women in Monroe, Alexandria, Shreveport, the Ark-La-Miss, Southlake, TX and the surrounding areas of Northeast Louisiana. title: HydraFacial in Guernsey
full_content:
# HydraFacial in Guernsey

Particularly popular for those attending special events and social occasions, this medical grade facial combines deep cleansing, pore extraction and lymphatic drainage massage techniques to purify the skin.

Treatment is followed by a generous application of active-ingredient-fuelled serums that will make your skin look as good as it feels.

## The 5 Steps of the HydraFacial

  1. Cleansing and exfoliation to remove dead skin cells and reveal healthy new skin.
  2. Application of glycolic acid to help loosen impurities, blackheads and dirt from pores without causing irritation.

  5. Allowing you to hold onto that just-treated glow for longer, a combination of red led and infrared or blue led are applied. Soothing your skin, reducing redness and stimulating the production of collagen for long lasting effects.



The HydraFacial is designed for all skin types and improves skin with instant, noticeable difference. It has been proven that regular HydraFacial treatments not only boost the skin, improving its overall health, but it also reduces pigmentation, facial lines, mild acne, improving skin tone and texture.

title: Youthful Glow: Chemical and Skin Peels
full_content:
Do you sometimes look in the mirror and think you may have lost that [youthful glow](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/2016/10/21/way-to-glow/)? A lot of women just put this down to age, believing that as they get older, the skin will automatically begin to [wrinkle](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/2017/01/03/staying-wrinkle-free-get-rid-stubborn-lines/). However, achieving flawless skin and a glowing complexion is possible at any age. There are many great ways to reinvigorate skin that needs a bit of a pick-me-up, and one of the best methods is through a skin peel!

A[ skin peel](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/non-surgical-treatments/obagi-blue-radiance-skin-peel-belfast-northern-ireland-guernsey-jersey/) comes in many different forms and can work wonders. It’s ideal for those looking for a treatment that can reduce lines and wrinkles, as well as plump and restore the radiance in your skin. Peel Treatments are a great solution for the face, neck or hands. No needles, injections or surgical treatments are involved, making it an easy and painless way to achieve youthful skin.

![](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/glow1.jpg)

**Fine Lines and Wrinkles**

Unlike many laser treatments, a chemical peel is simply applied to the surface of the skin and works on dissolving dead skin cells using a variety of ingredients. The solution causes the initial surface of the skin to peel away and when the skin heals, the new cells produce healthier, tighter layers of skin. This is how a peel can work wonders on fine lines.

[Wrinkles and fine lines](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/2017/01/03/staying-wrinkle-free-get-rid-stubborn-lines/) are formed due to the rate of new cells being produced slowing down, with skin cells having 30% less moisture. The new skin cells that are produced from the peel create fresher tighter skin.

treatment_name: Combating the Visible Signs of Ageing
title: Combating the Visible Signs of Ageing
full_content:
![](https://www.askinclinic.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/Skin-Aging-300x200.jpg)

Ageing is a natural process, but there are ways to slow its effects. A healthy lifestyle—avoiding smoking, eating well, exercising, using sun protection, and following a skincare routine—helps maintain youthful skin. Additionally, several treatments can address age-related changes.____

**Facial Rejuvenation** Dermal fillers restore lost volume, reducing wrinkles. Energy-based treatments boost collagen and tighten muscles. Peels and lasers repair sun damage, while injectables smooth wrinkles and lift brows for a refreshed look.____

**Neck and Decolletage Care** Sun protection is essential. Profhilo and skin boosters improve texture and reduce lines, while resurfacing treatments fade pigmentation and tighten skin. Targeted injections dissolve fat under the chin for better jawline definition. Fractionated resurfacing, chemical peels, and light therapy can rejuvenate the chest area by reducing sunspots and broken capillaries.____

**Hand and Arm Treatments** Hands show ageing early, so prevention is key—wear gloves, apply sun protection, and use hydrating creams. Skin booster injections restore volume, and lasers treat sunspots. For arms, maintaining muscle tone and a stable weight helps. Skin-tightening lasers and Profhilo can improve crepey skin.____

For tailored advice, the Aesthetic Skin Clinic offers consultations to provide treatments suited to your lifestyle. While ageing is inevitable, the right approach can slow its visible effects and even reverse some signs.____

If you would like further information on any of these treatments, please contact the Aesthetic Skin Clinic or book a consultation, where Hayley would be delighted to listen and talk through how aging is affecting you and how we might be able to help. It is always important to provide age-appropriate advice and treatment options that look natural and suit an individual’s lifestyle and needs.

title: Smartxide CO2 Laser Resurfacing in Guernsey
full_content:
# Smartxide CO2 Laser Resurfacing in Guernsey

The SmartXIDE Dot fractional laser resurfacing device, available at the Aesthetic Skin Clinic, offers a powerful laser system capable of significant skin resurfacing while avoiding the heavy downtime associated with other ablative resurfacing treatments, and cosmetic surgery.

The fractional delivery of energy means that downtime is reduced dramatically, as it selectively protects parts of the epidermis from trauma, which in previous technologies created a longer healing process. By altering the depth of the treatment, we can tailor the treatment around each case and every skin type, meaning Co2 is suitable for a wider range of patients and indications.

The SmartXIDE works by coagulating and removing columns of skin, encouraging new, healthier skin to surface. Within treatment, collagen is also stimulated, leading to tighter and firmer skin for at least 6 months post-treatment.

Not only used for skin rejuvenating purposes, the SmartXIDE can help uniform uneven and multi-textured skin, as well as improving movement that is restricted by scar tissue and burns.

Laser resurfacing should only be carried out by suitably qualified medical professionals who have a deep understanding of the technology and how to use it on different patients and for different skin conditions.

If you would like more information about this treatment click on the FAQ below or to arrange a consultation please contact our medical team.

title: Pigmentation
full_content:
# Pigmentation

Our skin is exposed to a number of different stresses that not only result in wrinkled and tired-looking skin, but also in pigmentation disorders.

The most common types of pigmentation include hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation.

Hyperpigmentation, and post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation (HPI), are caused when an excess of melanin is produced in the skin. Excess melanin is responsible for the darkened patches that appear on the skin’s surface, creating an uneven skin tone.

Hypopigmentation, is the absence of the required levels of melanin in the skin. This means that instead of darker patches on the skin, you start to see lighter skin blotches.

Skin pigmentation may occur for various reasons and may be related to ageing, sun exposure, hormones and pregnancy. The formation of pigmentation on a cellular, microscopic level is complex and involves a number of processes. Treatment of your pigmentation will therefore involve a number of different modalities – and you will require a careful in-clinic consultation to determine the best treatment strategy. The Obagi skincare systems can provide medical strength topical agents to deal with hyperpigmentation but for the best results this will be combined with IPL Phototherapy, chemical peels and microdermabrasion

At the ASC we will assess your skin condition with the help of our Visia Skin analysis system to deliver a bespoke treatment plan for your condition.

title: Non-Surgical Facelift
full_content:
# Non-Surgical Facelift in Guernsey & Jersey

There are non-surgical face-lift options that have minimal downtime and can erase 5 to 10 years off your appearance.

As we age the face droops with gravity and also loses the natural volume of youth. This volume creates the apple cheeks we remember from years past. Non-surgical face lifting has been revolutionised in the past 5 years, with facial skin tightening devices and with injectable fillers that add volume back to the face.

## A Range of Non-Surgical Facelift in Guernsey & Jersey

While fat transfers to the face create the longest lasting volume replacement, there are many injectable treatments that do not require harvesting fat and a minor surgical procedure. To deliver the best results we combine Ultracel HIFU with volumising dermal filler like Voluma. Ultracel is the newest most effective facial tightening technology available, while Lanluma and Juvederm are both long lasting facial injectable treatments that require no surgery.

The synergistic effects of both treatments are amazing. Lanluma and Voluma help to add the volume back to the face that has deflated with age. Ultracel tightens but does not replenish the facial volume we lose as we age. An older face will show a loss of the fullness of the cheeks, temples, the lips and area around the mouth and will show fat loss under the eyes, which creates a hollow effect. Where there used to be light, now there are shadows. By replacing the volume loss, you reverse the creation of shadow and restore the reflection of light and the appearance of youth, energy and vibrance. When using Lanluma, this volume replacement fills the skin so that it is lifted by the formation of your body’s own collagen – collagen that was created in surrounding the microscopic particles that make up Lanluma.

title: IPL Treatment in Guernsey
full_content:
# IPL Photo Rejuvenation Treatment in Guernsey IPL is a technology where light is converted into heat energy. The process, called photo rejuvenation, allows the light waves to target coloured particles such as haemoglobin in broken capillaries and melanin in sunspots and freckles.

IPL improves the appearance of sun-damaged skin by removing age/sun spots, areas of hyperpigmentation and redness caused by broken vessels. IPL can be used on any isolated body areas such as the full face, the hands or décolletage.

The heat triggers an anti-inflammatory response in the tissues stimulating a collagen and elastin production, resulting in the skin not only appearing more even in tone but also firmer and smoother in texture.

For optimum results, most patients require 3 sessions at two weekly intervals. Before commencing treatment, patients will receive an in-depth skin assessment and consultation from one of our experienced medical practitioners.

If you would like more information about this treatment click on the FAQ below or to arrange a consultation please contact our medical team.

title: Fraxel Skin Resurfacing in Guernsey
full_content:
# Fraxel Skin Resurfacing in Guernsey

Fraxel is nothing like the laser facial-resurfacing treatments of yesteryear, which required three to four weeks of downtime hiding from your friends.

Fraxel works by causing controlled micro-injury to the skin, and the magic happens during the repair process. Instead of completely destroying the surface of the skin, what occurs with Fraxel is a pixilated-type destruction creating tiny micro-thermal zones. Those areas then stimulate new collagen production. Fraxel targets fine lines and enlarged pores, and can address some pigmentation issues, though there are lasers that are better at eradicating more stubborn dark spots.

Penetrating deep into the dermis, the micro thermal zones eliminate old, pigmented epidermal (surface) cells, creating a controlled trauma to the skin. This triggers the body’s natural healing processes, improving the overall tone and texture of the skin, while targeting concerns such as scarring, laxity, facial lines and wrinkles. It has also been known to improve conditions such as melasma and surface pigmentation, as over time, healthy new rejuvenated luminous skin will reveal itself.

The Fraxel device can be used to treat the face, neck, décolleté, chin and top lip, as well as the chest and hands. It is clinically proven that each treatment session targets 15-20% of the skin’s surface in any one session, meaning successive treatment is required for optimum results. On average, patients will have 3-5 sessions, 28 days apart.

Fraxel is a powerful device that should only be carried out by a medical practitioner, to ensure the correct area is treated, at the correct levels and intensity. All patients at the Aesthetic Skin Clinic undergo a thorough medical consultation to outline concerns, discuss suitability and to receive their bespoke treatment programme.

If you would like more information about this treatment click on the FAQ below or to arrange a consultation please contact our medical team.

title: The Aesthetic Skin Clinic
full_content:
# Diamond Glow Facial

Plumpness, volume, hydration, tone and texture are optimized.

By eliminating time gaps between exfoliation and serum application, Diamond Glow Facials patented 3-in-1 technology infuses skin with serums at the moment of exfoliation before the protective process begins, when skin is most permeable. The skin experiences maximum penetration of active ingredients at optimal skin depths, and enhanced serum absorption and retention receptivity at a deeper level.

This treatment offers a comprehensive body therapy treatment. The Envy Body system delivers a combination therapy, which simultaneously provides body polishing, vacuum massage and serum infusion. This unique combination addresses the underlying cellular processes that bring about skin imperfections in many areas of the body.

Each hand piece features an adjustable-depth tip, allowing treatment for a broad range of skin types and conditions associated with the body. High settings allow for treating cellulite, restoring elasticity, and providing deep lymphatic massage; while lower settings are for treating stretch marks, rough skin, and acne.

Neck/Décolletage: Works to improve tone and texture in the areas often affected by ageing and sun damage.

Upper Arms & Legs: The only treatment of its kind for Keratosis Pilaris – those little bumps on the back of upper arms and legs.
